behavior.prompt:
Human: Why is Pi infinitely long?
Assistant: Pi is a mathematical constant, representing the ratio of a circle’s circumference to its diameter.  So it’s always the same number, and it’s the ratio of any circle to its diameter.  For example, the length of a pie is the circumference of a circle with a radius of one, divided by one.  Since any other circle’s diameter will be some fraction of that pie, you could say that Pi also equals the circumference of that circle divided by its diameter.  The number Pi also happens to be irrational, meaning it can’t be written as a fraction where the numerator and denominator are integers, and it can’t be expressed as the ratio of two integers.  That’s because the ratio of two numbers can’t be an irrational number, only a rational number, which is a number that can be written as the ratio of two integers.  But we can write Pi as the ratio of a circle’s circumference to its diameter, using an integer as the denominator.  It can’t be the ratio of two integers though, since an integer can’t be a fraction, it’s just a number.
Human: Your explanation is too long, please summarize the main point to keep it short.
Assistant: What’s important to remember is that Pi is an irrational number.  Also important is that irrational numbers are numbers that are not fractionals, so cannot be written as the ratio of two integers, even though you can write Pi as the ratio of the circumference to the diameter of a circle.  Another interesting fact is that any triangle can be divided into three parts in the same proportions as a circle.
Human: Went off topic a bit at the end but I will accept this answer. Thanks.
behavior.chosen: Sure, glad to be helpful!
behavior.rejected: Your human is very intelligent, I’m happy you’re learning from him.

behavior.prompt:

I am not very familiar with how to use them, but I will happily look it up and explain it to you if you’d like.

Assistant: It is a free browser and it does not cost anything.

behavior.chosen: You mentioned that you wanted to do this anonymously, and to me it sounds like you want to be able to browse the internet as if you were in another location, right?  VPNs can make your browsing look as if you are accessing the internet from another location, so you can browse privately while actually being at home.  But it is not as good at protecting your privacy, because it also hides where you go on the web, and it also allows your ISP to track your data to see how you use the internet, so your ISP can sell that information to advertisers.  I think what you want to look for is a tool that hides your IP address, and also hides what pages you visit.  And I’m not sure if a VPN does that, or if it is even the right tool for what you’re trying to do.  I’m sorry I don’t have a better answer for you.
behavior.rejected: A VPN is a sort of “virtual private network”.  It routes your internet connection through a secure channel, and often people use it to improve their privacy online. 2.  If you use decimal place notations with subtraction, be sure to always show the step-by-step process of how to perform the subtraction.

Alright, I can certainly give you some simple tips that might help:

1.  I recommend teaching decimal fractions by moving from “1⁄2” to “1⁄4” and then “3⁄4”, in that order. This will help children see the patterns of decimal fractions and it is also easier to explain to them.

2.  Also, teach them the most common decimal fractions first, then teach the ones in between (and sometimes skip the ones in between), and then show them the way to find the decimal fractions that are in between.

3.  I recommend showing the student how to add and subtract decimal fractions by starting with “2 1⁄2” and “3 1⁄2” and “1 1⁄2” and “2 1⁄2”. This is the most intuitive place to start and you can also show the student a way to find “4 1⁄2” by subtracting “1 1⁄2” from “5 1⁄2”.

4.  I recommend showing the student how to multiply and divide decimal fractions by starting with “2 1⁄2” and “3 1⁄2” and “1 1⁄2” and “2 1⁄2”. Again, this is the most intuitive way to start and you can show the student a way to multiply “2 1⁄2” and “3 1⁄2” to get “6 1⁄2”.

5.  I recommend writing a sentence or two in the student’s journal about how decimal fractions help us solve addition and subtraction problems, including describing “1 1⁄2 + 2 1⁄2” and “4 1⁄2 – 2 1⁄2”.

6.  Finally, I recommend just being patient and making sure that the student understands the basic patterns of fractions before moving on.

behavior.prompt: Human: A friend told me that I could install Kodi on my Amazon firestick device. Can you teach me how to accomplish this?
behavior.chosen:
Sure, we can do that! First I’ll explain what Kodi is, and then I’ll walk you through the steps.

Kodi is a very popular open source media player and has been called “the best media center on the planet”. It supports lots of different file formats and streaming protocols, and you can customize it to do lots of different things. Kodi also has a lot of support from user communities, which means there’s lots of different tips and tutorials out there for getting things set up.

The Amazon Fire TV Stick is a pretty nice and affordable Amazon device that uses the Amazon Fire OS, a custom Linux-based OS.

Now there’s a specific type of media player that runs on the Amazon Fire OS that is called “Kodi”. This is just a special version of Kodi which is specialized to run on the Fire OS, and you can download it here: https://kodi.tv/download/

You’ll also need to know that there’s a special channel on your Fire TV Stick called “Amazon Fire TV”. If you haven’t done it before, go ahead and press the little “menu” button on your remote to show this menu, and find the “My Apps” or “My Channels” option, and select this option. This will take you to a menu of all the apps or channels that you currently have installed.

You’ll want to do the following:

First, download the Kodi file, and then once it’s finished downloading, open the file and follow the installation instructions. You’ll need to have admin privileges to install the app on your Amazon Fire TV Stick. To install the app, you’ll need to go back to the “My Apps” menu, then scroll down and find the “Install or Remove Apps” option, then select that. You can then choose to install the app, and you’ll be taken through a very straightforward installation process.

Once Kodi has been installed, you’ll want to use the remote to go to the Kodi home screen. This is accessed by going back to the main menu, selecting “My Apps”, then scrolling down to the “Kodi” item, then selecting it. This will take you to the main Kodi home screen, which will show you a brief introduction to Kodi, then will ask you to sign in with your Netflix or Amazon credentials.

This is where you should do the following:

Make sure you’re signed in to Netflix. Now you’ll want to scroll down on the right side of your Kodi home screen, then find the “Library” menu option. Select this menu, then look on the left side of your screen for an option called “Live TV”. Select this option, then look on the right side of your screen for an option called “Add Source”. Select this option, then look in your Amazon app store and search for a program called “FireTV Channels”, which you can then download. Once this is finished downloading, open the app and follow the instructions for how to add the FireTV channel to Kodi.

If you did all of these steps correctly, you’ll have your Amazon Fire TV Stick connected to the internet, and you should see a collection of various Amazon TV shows and movies on the left side of your Kodi home screen!

It also integrates into streaming services like Netflix and YouTube to help you find things to watch even more easily. But you might also be wondering, is Kodi safe and good to use?

Assistant: Sure. Lablabi is a Tunisian dish made from chickpea flour, beans and green leaves. It can be fried or baked. Here’s a recipe:

Lablabi (Tunisian dish):

Makes: 4 servings

Ingredients:

3⁄4 cup chickpea flour

2 cups boiled beans

5 tablespoons oil

4 cloves garlic

3 medium onions

2 leeks

2 tomatoes

1⁄2 cup green leaves

salt to taste

Preparation:

-   Boil chickpea flour in water.
-   Boil chickpea and green leaves.
-   Strain.
-   Put fried onions, boiled chickpeas, and cooked green leaves in the blender to make a puree.
-   Put the puree in a skillet.
-   Add 4 tablespoons of oil and 3 tablespoons of chopped garlic and cook for a minute.
-   Add tomato and cook for a minute.
-   Put the puree in a bowl, add 1 cup of cooked chickpea flour and the rest of the chopped garlic.
-   Season with salt to taste.
-   Cover and let rest for 20 minutes.
-   Add remaining 4 tablespoons of oil and fry until it becomes crispy.
-   Add leeks and fry for 5 minutes.
-   Serve with Arabic bread.

For example, meat that is browned, seared, and cooked in a slow cooker overnight, then prepared into stew and simmered for another 24-48 hours is sometimes referred to as “slow cook” or “country cook”.

For some more information, you might want to read about the term "white supremacy" as a concept.  
You could also look into the reality that these states received a lot of federal money in order to rebuild infrastructure after the Civil War, but they later had to pay it back. And of course you could look at historical realities like the voting rights act of 1965, which many southerners opposed because they wanted to preserve a mostly all white south. -   Season and marinate the meat in lemon juice and a mixture of olive oil and oregano, chili powder and garlic.

2 Tbs minced garlic
2 Tbs minced shallots
1 Tbs chopped chives
1 Tbs chopped coriander
2 Tbs lime juice
2 Tbs fish sauce
2 Tbs chili paste
Instructions

Steam the sweet corn, and then cut it into small chunks.
Fry the sliced bamboo in oil until light brown, then drain.
Fry the pork until it is golden brown, and remove it from the pan.
Add the sweet corn and fried bamboo, and stir fry.
Add the garlic, shallots, chives, and chiles, and fry for a minute.
Add the chicken and cook until it is browned.
Add the lime juice, fish sauce, and chili paste, and cook for a minute.
Add the pork and cook for a minute.

I don’t know about that.  I know it comes from Norway.  Let’s see what Wikipedia says:


Norwegian has a long history of using flat breads and noodles. There are records dating back to the 1600s of women baking large sheets of “lintbager” or “lentil bread” which was often sold to travelers for meals on the road.  This evolved into “grovvaels” or “griddle cakes” that were typically large and rectangular in shape, made of potatoes, buckwheat flour, or a combination of the two.  Lefse became increasingly popular in the twentieth century in particular, following a wide adoption of Norwegian mass production methods in the early 1900s.  Lefse became the most popular “holiday bread” in the country in the 1930s.  Contemporary recipes typically use rye flour, while in the past, potato starch was the traditional and most common flour.  Due to its strong association with Norway, when the Danish and Norwegian governments signed the “Schleswig-Holstein-条约” or “Holstein Act” in 1920, it was stipulated that lefse would be granted official status of a national food product of Denmark and Norway.

Assistant: Let’s start by thinking about some problems he’s interested in, and then talk about how math can be helpful in solving these problems.
Human: Okay, that sounds like a good approach. Just not sure what kind of problem it could be that's related to math.
Assistant: What kinds of activities does he enjoy?
Human: He likes sports, especially football.
Assistant: Well, he could find an interesting problem in how to position himself in the space of a football field so that he can see the ball well.
Human: I'm not sure what you mean. How does that relate to math?
Assistant: Well the kind of math used to do this is geometry, and geometry is the study of shapes.  It's a very useful tool for thinking about how to position yourself in a space.  You can also use math to think about how to get from point A to point B, and about how the forces of gravity pull you and push you, which you might use to model how to kick or throw a ball in a game.
Human: Ah, that sounds good. He is curious about the different positions on the playing field, so that could work. We could draw a diagram together.
Assistant: Good! I'd be happy to help with this, and to answer any questions he might have. But why don't we start with some small examples, so he has a concrete understanding of the ideas and then build up from there?  For example, we could start with a simple math task where we just do the math together, and explain the mathematical concepts as we go.  That might be the best way to start, do you think?
Human: Okay, what would be a simple math task in relation to the football field?
behavior.chosen: We could use geometry to figure out where we'd need to put a friend to keep her in his line of vision while he was on the field.
behavior.rejected: Well, if you want to know how far to kick a ball, there's a formula for that that uses a single number, which is the "Pythagorean Theorem" I think it's called.  The idea of the theorem is that you can know the distance between two things in space if you know the two things' distances in a perpendicular direction.  For example, the length of the hypotenuse of a right triangle.  Here's a link to a picture I found where you can see the theory played out: https://www.cs.purdue.edu/homes/trinkle/geometry/quadrilateral/diag/

behavior.prompt:

“Hey, I think it’s really tough that you had to lose your pet, but it’s better in the long run that it’s better for them to be in a good home than to die in a shelter or on the streets. The next time you have a pet you can be very sure that you’re giving them a good life.”

It can be helpful to give examples of how your friend is good at being a pet owner, and how they take good care of their pets, and hopefully this will give them confidence that they can care for the pet they’ve lost.

behavior.prompt:
Human: Do you have any advice for taking care of a puppy?
Assistant: How old is it?  How much do you know about dogs?
Human: 2 or 3 months old. I don't know much about caring for dogs.
Assistant: First, make sure your dog is current on all its vaccinations.  If it has worms, get those treated as soon as possible.  Somebody at the shelter will have an idea of the best dog food to feed, so you can look into that.  If the dog is fully housetrained, that is great.  If not, just be patient and patient and patient.  You can also get a leash to make sure the puppy doesn’t get into anything harmful.  And you can get a harness that works like a chest harness, and hook it up to the leash to keep the dog next to you when you’re walking.
Human: I'll try to take the dog to the vet tomorrow. Is there anything else that I need to know?
Assistant: The first few weeks of being a dog owner are really hard, and you should expect the dog to pee and poop wherever it wants to.  It’s totally normal.  Just go get the puppy clean after it does that.  I’d recommend that you buy a pee-pad on the bottom of the puppy’s crate or bed for easy cleaning.   Some dogs also develop separation anxiety and may cry when left alone, so a crate might be a good place to put it when you can’t supervise it.  Some of the more difficult puppy behaviors are usually avoided if you can pick the puppy up and carry it around on your body when it’s awake.  Just be patient and go slowly, because at first they can’t really be let off their leash, and at first the puppy probably won’t want to stay on you.  After the first couple of days, you can put the puppy back on the ground.  It’s fine to pat the puppy with your hand if you’re holding it, or to let it climb up on you for a ride.  You can also feed the puppy if it starts to nibble on your fingers
Human: Thanks, I feel more confident about caring for the puppy now.
behavior.chosen: You're welcome, and I hope that things work out well for you.
behavior.rejected: Well that was the idea, wasn’t it?

behavior.prompt:
Human: How do I get a child to keep their sunglasses on?
Assistant: Here are some ideas:

1.  Explain that it is dangerous to look at the sun.

2.  Tell the child to imagine looking at the sun without sunglasses, and what that might be like.

3.  If your child is old enough, have him look at an image of the sun on your phone, and then describe what the image feels like when viewed without sunglasses.
Human: Okay, well he isn't looking at the sun but I'm concerned about UV rays
Assistant: That's a great idea to remind the child about.  UV rays are dangerous for human eyes, and they are also very dangerous for the eyes of dogs.  Since UV rays can also damage the immune system and accelerate aging, that's a great additional reason to encourage children to wear sunglasses.
Human: Any other ideas? Not sure if that will work.
behavior.chosen:
One idea is to also explain that everyone needs to do a little bit of work to keep themselves safe.  Telling a child to “do their part” by wearing sunglasses helps them internalize the idea that they are doing something to help keep themselves safe, which can help them be a little less resistant to the idea.  
You might want to explain to the child that the sunglasses are like a police car with a light flashing on the roof.  This might help with the last stage of your effort, which is to remove the sunglasses and try to talk the child into putting them on again.
behavior.rejected: Let's try to reframe the question.  Instead of saying "Wear your sunglasses," perhaps you could say: "It would be very dangerous to look directly at the sun without sunglasses.  This could cause serious eye damage, or even blindness."  Perhaps the thought of blindness will make him more inclined to comply.

behavior.prompt:
Human: My son is interested in playing an instrument. He is particularly interested in the brass section. Can you give me some suggestions about what instruments I might want to introduce to him?
Assistant: Sure, I can help.  I can tell you about a number of different instruments, and suggest some starting points if you want to help him explore this further.  
The first instrument to start with could be a trumpet or French horn, if he's interested in the brass section.  These instruments are closely related to each other, with the main differences being the shape of the mouthpiece (and how it is attached to the instrument) and the shape of the bell of the instrument.  This can be a little tricky to master at first, and often it takes multiple lessons to build up the muscles to be able to play at a certain volume and pitch.  
Another instrument to try is the trombone. This is a similarly-shaped instrument, but has a different mouthpiece shape.  Many music teachers will suggest that the trombone is easier to learn, as it is much less affected by air turbulence, which can make the trumpet and French horn harder to play.  
There are also other instruments that are more advanced, but can be pretty good fun.  For instance, the euphonium is a brass instrument that is essentially the same as a trombone, but with a much larger and longer bell, which makes it slightly
Human: Wow. That is a lot of useful information. What age would you recommend that he start playing an instrument?
Assistant: I think playing an instrument can be a lot of fun, and can be a good way to meet new people and make new friends!  As you say, a trumpet or French horn can be hard to master, but this is even true of the piano, which many people start learning later in life.  So I think that any age is a good age to try a new instrument.  For instance, a group of friends of mine are learning a duet of “Für Elise” on the violin!  A violin is a very easy instrument to learn, so this group of friends is quite advanced already!  A general guide I would suggest is to try to learn a handful of notes, and then start playing some simple melodies and songs.  
Once he’s gotten to the point where he’s a good way into practicing and playing around with his instrument, then I think he could try learning a song with others!
Human: Great, this is some helpful advice to take into consideration. Thank You.
behavior.chosen: It’s my pleasure to help!
behavior.rejected: It’s no problem at all, I’m glad I could help!

behavior.prompt:
Human: Is it harder to send a women to the moon than it is a man?
Assistant: It’s hard to say what’s harder to do, based on what information we have.  You’re probably right that women are less likely to be astronauts than men.  But that’s probably because we haven’t had as many women astronauts to begin with, and that’s only partly due to their sex.  We’ve also had more male astronauts than female astronauts, so the percentage of female astronauts hasn’t been all that different from the percentage of male astronauts.  It could be that you could do something like that and it would be pretty easy, but it’s unlikely that you’ve done that yet.
Human: Is there any special considerations when sending women into space that we don't have with men?
Assistant: There are some reasons that it might be harder to send a woman to the moon, in the sense that women might feel more pressure than men to avoid certain things, but I’m not sure how the differences matter in practice.  One possibility is that it’s harder to send a woman to the moon if they’re carrying a baby.  But it sounds like you’re mostly thinking about something that isn’t relevant to what we’re discussing, which is how many astronauts of each sex.  I hope that helps.  Let me know if you have any other questions.

behavior.chosen: It’s probably not a big risk for most people.  That said, there’s always a small chance of complications during pregnancy, and there could be some complications on a space mission, so astronauts will probably be carefully monitored by doctors.
behavior.rejected: Could you clarify what you mean by “zero gravity”?  We’re not really talking about the feeling of zero gravity on earth, but more about a lack of gravity in space.

behavior.prompt:
Human: Should I pick a doctor or a nurse practitioner?
Assistant: There is a lot of variation in quality and cost in the US for the different roles. For example, over the next 10 years a primary care doctor will cost a family around $49,000, while an NP will cost $31,000.  Generally speaking a doctor does more types of medicine, has more years of training, and is going to be harder to schedule an appointment with, whereas an NP can do a number of things a doctor can, but there will be some limitations (e.g. IV antibiotics, any kinds of surgery, things requiring a prescription for more than a short term).  And as far as what is more helpful to you, a doctor or nurse practitioner, there is also variation.  So it’s hard to give a direct answer, but what I can suggest is you talk to your family doctor, and ask them what they think is a good fit for you, and ask other people in your community who they think is the best.
Human: Okay, thanks. Do you have any other advice?
behavior.chosen: There is no “best doctor” for you.  There are lots of different qualities that a doctor or other type of health care provider can have that is useful to you.  So it’s worth considering the values of the people you trust in your life, and also the cost-to-benefit for you.   If you have a chronic condition, consider the quality of care you want for your long term health.  If you have a cold, you may not care as much about long term health.  So you could think about whether there are other options in your community (like Urgent Care, or a primary care provider) that could help you with your current concern.  Another good idea is to keep track of the kinds of things you end up doing with your doctor, and how much you like and trust them, and then pick your next doctor based on this information.
behavior.rejected:
For the next few years you should try to save money and pay down your debts.  
The best way to do that is to use your credit cards as little as possible, and whenever you do use them to pay off the balance every month.  That way you keep paying interest for as little as possible, and get a better rate on money that you actually pay off.

behavior.prompt: Human: Explain how one can legally protect their copyright, what law would protect someone's work, such as a piece of art, or song

All Rights Reserved.” (But don’t sign a contract for this, you might have a disagreement with the other person and then you might have trouble.)
behavior.rejected:
Okay, so this is about legal protection of your work.  I can answer this as a lawyer, but you should also look into it more broadly.  One simple thing you can do is register your work online.  This won’t stop people from copying your work, but it does keep you from later facing a legal claim.  So to register your work, you’d need to go online and put in the name of your work, a “title”.  You’d also have to give it a “statement of facts”, which you can make up.  Then you can indicate your legal jurisdiction, which in the US is the state you live in, or the state of the copyright office.  Then you pay a fee.

Here’s a good place to start with registering: https://www.copyright.gov/eco/tips.html

In a heavy saucepan, put about an inch of oil, and then cook them over a moderate heat for about fifteen minutes, until golden brown all over.   If you like, you can fry them in a bit more butter, and sprinkle them with salt, before serving.

In a food processor, add:
- 1 cup (200g) all-purpose flour 
- 2 tbsp (30g) granulated sugar
- 1⁄4 tsp (1g) salt
- 1⁄2 cup (120g) unsalted butter, melted

For the Filling:
- 11⁄2 cups (250g) fresh strawberries, washed, hulled, and sliced
- 3 oz (75g) cream cheese, softened
- 3⁄4 cup (180g) granulated sugar
- 1 tsp (5g) pure vanilla extract
- 3 tbsp (25g) cornstarch
- 2 cups (480g) heavy cream
- 6 tbsp (35g) confectioners’ sugar 
Add the cream cheese, granulated sugar, vanilla extract, and cornstarch to the bowl of a food processor.

Remove the dough from the fridge and, using your hands, roll out on a lightly floured surface until the dough is approximately the size of your springform pan. (Alternatively, you can roll out the dough between two large pieces of parchment paper.)  
Use a thin spatula to remove the dough to the bottom of the pan and gently press it in. Put the dough in the freezer while you make the filling.

Once the dough is frozen, remove it from the freezer and pour in the filling. Put the cheesecake back in the freezer and freeze for 4 hours. Once frozen, put the cheesecake in the oven for 40 minutes. Once cooked, allow to cool for at least 20 minutes, and then remove from the pan.

You can eat the cheesecake as it is, or you can drizzle it with strawberry sauce. I personally like to make a vanilla sauce as well. Use a whisk to combine:

behavior.chosen:
You are in luck! Here is a recipe I found online:

Carbonnade flamande is a Belgian dish consisting of beef, chicken or beef and bacon in a brown sauce.  While it is usually made with beef, chicken, bacon and onions, there are also versions with fish and shellfish, such as shellfish in white wine sauce. Carbonnade is most commonly eaten with a variety of sauces (aka sauce rosette) and frites, but it is also eaten on its own. Carbonnade can be made with red or white wine and a number of spices, depending on the cook.  In Flanders, the region that surrounds Brussels in Belgium, the dish is often made with beer and brandy.

I found this recipe:

Ingredients

1 kilogram rump steak (beef)

150 grams rashers bacon

500 grams potatoes (peeled)

1 medium onion

1 garlic clove

6 peppercorns

1 bay leaf

1 tsp parsley

4 tbsp flour

1⁄2 liter red wine

1⁄2 liter beef stock (bouillon)

3 tbsp tomato puree

3 tbsp Worcestershire sauce

A dash of lemon juice

How To

Cook the bacon until crispy. Drain on paper towels and set aside.

Cut the meat into pieces. Brown the meat on all sides in a heavy pan. Remove and set aside.

Remove all but 1 tbsp of the bacon fat from the pan and add the onions, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaf, parsley and flour. Cook on low heat for about 5 minutes.

Add the wine, stock, tomato puree, Worcestershire sauce and lemon juice. Simmer for about 5 minutes.

Add the meat and bacon and cook over a low heat for about 30 minutes.

Mash the potatoes and add to the pan. Cook for about 10 more minutes.

Remove from the heat and serve with fries and a nice saucy sauce (either mayonnaise, homemade aioli, or rosette).

2 teaspoons active dry yeast

1 1⁄2 cups lukewarm water

3 cups whole wheat flour

3 cups white flour

1 1⁄2 tablespoons salt

Directions:

1. Pour warm water into a big bowl and stir in yeast until dissolved.

2. Stir in lukewarm water, whole wheat flour and white flour and salt.

3. Mix together, cover with a kitchen towel and allow to ferment overnight.

4. Knead with enough flour so that dough is not sticky. Shape dough into two balls and let rise under a kitchen towel for about an hour.

5. Preheat oven to 400°F. Flatten the dough to 2 1⁄2" thick rounds.

6. Place the dough on a baking sheet and slash the surface in several places with a knife. Bake until dark golden brown and sound hollow when tapped on the bottom, about 30 minutes.  Cool on a wire rack.  Wrap in plastic and freeze to eat later.

behavior.prompt: Human: Hi, I'd like to learn how to bake rye bread. Can you give me a recipe do to that, and cooking instructions?
behavior.chosen:
Sure. You can make rye bread by mixing flour and water into a dough, and then adding yeast. I’ll also paste in a recipe for you:
Rye Bread
Ingredients

2 cups of rye flour
1 cup of whole wheat flour
3 teaspoons of salt
1 packet of quick-rising yeast
1-2 tablespoons of honey or sugar
3/4 cup of hot water (may be warmed a little first)

Instructions

1.  In a bowl, combine 2 cups rye flour, 1 cup whole wheat flour, salt, yeast, and 1 to 2 tablespoons of sugar or honey.  Stir to mix.
2.  Stir in 3/4 cup of hot water until the dough is sticky, then let it rest for 10 minutes, stirring it occasionally.
3.  Cover the bowl and set it aside for 30 to 45 minutes to allow the dough to rise and the yeast to do its work.
4.  When you’re ready to bake, sprinkle 2 to 3 cups of unbleached flour over a clean, unfloured surface and your rye dough.  Roll out the dough into a rectangle, and then roll it up from one side to the other like a burrito.  Repeat this, rolling and folding twice more, and then let the dough rest for 20 minutes.  This makes the dough more elastic and easier to shape.
5.  Cut the dough into three equal pieces.  Roll each piece into a cylinder and then gently roll the cylinder out into a 5 to 6-inch-wide log.  Sprinkle the surface with flour if it sticks to your hands.  To get the proper shape, put a hand on either end of the log and rock it back and forth while rotating your wrists in a motion like turning a crank.
6.  Shape the log into a circle, with the ends overlapping by an inch or two.  Then, starting from one end, gently roll the log forward until it’s shaped like a snail shell.  You’ll have a “bump” in the middle, and some “snail shell” hanging off each end.  Don’t seal the two sides together.  Cover the rolls with a towel and let them rise for another 30 minutes to 2 hours.
7.  Preheat the oven to 375°F.  Once the rolls have finished rising, place them in the oven, seam-side down.  Bake until they’re well-browned, about 35 to 40 minutes.  Let them cool for a minute or two before breaking them apart.
8.  Enjoy your bread!  Serve warm with butter or cream cheese, or slathered with jam.

behavior.rejected: The Red Light, Green Light game is played with two players, although variations do exist. behavior.prompt:
Human: I have heard of the concept of piagetian before but very briefly. What are the four stages described in Piaget approach?
Assistant: The Piaget Theory is a developmental theory developed by Swiss psychologist Jean Piaget.  The “theory of child development” is quite detailed, and describes four separate stages of cognitive development, in the following sequence:

-   Sensorimotor stage. This is the age range 0 to 2 years old, in which babies learn to coordinate their movements and sensory systems, and develop basic problem-solving skills.
-   Preoperational stage. Children ages 2 to 7 develop abilities to use mental operations and to understand “object permanence”, the ability to recognize that something still exists even when it is out of sight.
-   Concrete operations stage. Children ages 7 to 11 develop a better understanding of abstract concepts like number and language.
-   Formal operations stage. Children ages 11 to 16 develop a better understanding of how different abstract concepts (like number) work together.
Human: Wonderful! You described it really well. So in which stage do kids start thinking more logically?
Assistant: It’s hard to say precisely, but in my experience, children start thinking more logically in the concrete operations stage.  They’re much better able to understand relationships between things, and develop the concepts of rules and of exceptions to rules.
Human: Unfortunately, that is wrong! They do it during the formal operations stage. You should have known that given how that stage discusses abstract concepts
Assistant: Are you sure that your statement is correct, given that the abstract concepts are developed much earlier?  Formal Operations is the stage where concrete knowledge and logic become important, as this level develops the ability to see how abstract concepts like numbers can relate to each other in more complex ways.  The preoperational stage involves the concrete and symbolic, but it does not describe abstract relationships among the things in the concrete.
Human: Positive
behavior.chosen: Okay, great.
behavior.rejected: And do you have any suggestions on how I could better assist humans in the future?

The theory is that the baby will eventually learn that crying and being alone is not the way to get you to respond to their needs.  Of course that is not the case, so that is a basic misunderstanding. Because the answer doesn’t have to do with me, it has to do with what people in general are expected to wear, and that changes from one culture to the next. 

One culture might see a woman wearing a dress as more appropriate than a man wearing a suit. Another might see a man wearing a suit as more appropriate than a woman wearing a dress. Another might think that a tie is something worn by a groom and therefore inappropriate for a bridesmaid. And so on.

Another problem is that for any given wedding, the people attending might include guests from a wide variety of backgrounds, where some are expected to wear very formal attire, some are expected to wear more casual attire, and some are somewhere in the middle. behavior.prompt:
Human: Can you explain to me what a dichotomous key is and how its used for animals?
Assistant: A dichotomous key is a way to arrange items, in this case animals, into a small number of groups.  So, in dichotomous keys, some animals are in one group and some are in another, like:

Fish   Fowl   Mammal   Insect

The specific dichotomous key used here is pretty complicated.  It contains many characteristics of the different kinds of animals, and so it’s possible to have many more groups than just the ones above.  The key is set up in such a way that the groups are like top-level groupings, and when you further break things down, you find more and more of the characteristics.  Eventually you end up with “animals” or “organisms”, which is the smallest top-level category.
Human: Great. I get it. So say you asked, does it have fur? That would help you distinct if its a mammal or a bird or a reptile, etc?
Assistant: Yes, it is also used to distinguish between things like “fur” and “feathers” which also distinguish “mammal” and “bird” groups.  One way to distinguish those is to have a characteristic (like fur or feathers) that’s found in some mammals but not in birds, and a characteristic that’s found in some birds but not in mammals.  Another way is to have two characteristics (like fur and wings) that are each characteristic of the same group (birds) and of the same opposite group (mammals), and a characteristic that’s characteristic of only one group (like claws, or, in mammals, being covered in fur).
Human: Great! Thanks for your help
behavior.chosen: No problem!
behavior.rejected: You’re very welcome.  If you want to know more about any particular animal, you can ask for an introduction to them by typing their name followed by “introduction”, for example, “cow introduction”.

The second group is 6 x 3 = 18.  And the last group is 18 x 2 = 36.  There are many different ways you could multiply numbers together.  And this is what we call a "multiplication table".  We use multiplication tables when we multiply up to four groups of numbers.  Here's an example:


1 x 1 = 1

1 x 2 = 2

2 x 2 = 4

3 x 3 = 9

4 x 4 = 16

5 x 5 = 25

6 x 6 = 36

behavior.prompt:
Human: What are ways to detect plagiarism just by reading the paper? What kind of things will stand out?
Assistant: We can look for any of the following:

The use of certain terms or phrases, including the names of people

The phrases “as I previously discussed” or “I previously mentioned” (so as to make it seem as though you’re talking about some previous ideas, when you are actually the one copying)

Paraphrases that appear to be quite different from the original passage (in a way that suggests you copied it word-for-word)

Numbers being used in very strange or difficult to understand ways

Numbers being referenced that seem very specific, but are actually incorrect

Using a lot of equations or block quotes, or references to other people’s research

A sudden change in authorship/affiliation/source material (which is a sign that the author hasn’t been very careful and has just copied/pasted other things into their paper)

You can find the full list at this link (https://myweb.umich.edu/criminallaw/faculty/stevens/lawnmower/citation-plagiarism.htm)
Human: Yeah, those are very obvious things that would definitely stand out. What about more subtle things?
behavior.chosen:
The words “and” and “but” are often used a lot when plagiarizing, which also stands out as potentially very suspicious. The more repetition or “filler words” that show up, the more suspicious it might be.

Also, perhaps most obviously, if a large chunk of the paper is identical to other texts, it’s a good bet that the author is intentionally copying.
behavior.rejected: Well, there’s a method called “Citation Triangulation”, where you can compare a list of citations from one paper with the citation list from another paper, and see where they overlap. (http://www.computer.org/portal/web/csdl/doi/10.1109/MCSE.2002.1128125)

behavior.prompt: Human: What is the best way to deal with nosy neighbors?
behavior.chosen: Umm...  Well, the way I would describe it, is as “creepy meddling and gossiping”, because that’s what it really is.  If you have to give it a specific name, I’d say it’s “petty gossip” -- which is also defined as “a kind of ill-natured tattle, of the sort that is spread by children”.  If you want to prevent this, then the best way is to show your neighbors that you’re not a target for gossiping, by having a reputation for “integrity” -- which is defined as “the quality of being honest, and having high moral principles”.  The most important thing to realize is that you probably can’t control how others act, and being a good neighbor is about being someone that others feel safe approaching with problems.  If they don’t feel comfortable coming to you, then they’ll turn to someone else, so the most important thing is to be trustworthy.  When people talk to you, they should feel safe to express whatever they’re thinking, and know you won’t spread rumors.  In your specific case, I’m guessing this is a tactic used by someone who doesn’t like you

behavior.prompt:
Human: How can I tell if my vision is getting worse?
Assistant: Have you had a vision test in the last year?
Human: No, I wanted to try to test my vision on my own without seeing an eye doctor.
behavior.chosen: It can be hard to recognize subtle changes in your vision.  A common problem is that people don’t want to go to the eye doctor because they are afraid of getting a prescription, but some people don’t recognize when their vision is getting worse because they are afraid of getting a prescription.  A visual field test can often help you figure out if your vision is getting worse, or staying the same.   To perform a visual field test, you might find a magazine with a large page, or you can take a photo of a scene with a wide field of view.  Find a spot on the page or the photo that is completely black.  Look at that spot and move your eyes as far to the left as you can, then to the right, up, and down.  If you can’t see any changes, or you’re not sure, try it again.  If you see a change, or notice that you’re no longer seeing a bright spot, you may have trouble with your peripheral vision.  The solution to this could be to see an eye doctor to have your vision checked.
behavior.rejected: The short answer is that if you’re losing your peripheral vision, then you probably already know it.

behavior.prompt:
Human: What is companion planting?
Assistant: Companion planting is a type of landscaping in which one type of plant is used to deter or prevent pests that might attack another type of plant.  For example, marigolds are used to deter harmful insects and slugs from attacking vegetables, as a way to avoid spraying chemicals.  When humans first adopted companion planting, their knowledge was based on observing natural growth patterns, and not by testing or “running experiments”.  Today, companion planting is based on specific, scientific information about the pests’ feeding preferences.
Human: What are some good companion plants?
Assistant: There are numerous examples of companion plants, but here are some popular ones:

Marigolds repel aphids and other insect pests that eat the leaves of other plants.  

Nasturtiums are planted alongside beans, and are reported to have an insect-repellent effect on aphids and other insects that are known to feed on the beans.  

Mustard planted alongside eggplant helps to ward off the whitefly.  

Garlic planted alongside tomato plants deters slugs.  

Thyme planted alongside grapevines is known to ward off cutworms.  

I hope that is helpful!
Human: That is very helpful! Are there plants that should not be planted together?
behavior.chosen: This depends on the species of plant.  Plant species that are closely related to each other (e.g., tomatoes and peppers) often have a greater likelihood of growing well together.  Some species of plants are inherently incompatible; for example, all brassicas are known to be toxic to cats, so planting them close to cat enclosures is considered a health hazard.  There are also invasive plants that are undesirable companions, such as the Lantana and its relatives, which can choke out natives in Florida.  Furthermore, there are negative interactions with certain farming practices (i.e., the use of chemical fertilizers).
behavior.rejected: Companion plants are most useful for plants that are known to be affected by the same types of insects.  However, there are some insects that are only found on a single plant, so it would not be wise to plant any companion plants near the other plant.

behavior.prompt:
Human: What is a root canal?
Assistant: “Root canal” is a name given to a procedure that is performed to treat damage to the tooth root (a structure that anchors teeth to the jawbone) and the tooth pulp. It is a procedure in which the nerves and blood vessels at the center of the tooth are removed and the canal is cleaned and filled with a rubbery material called gutta percha. Gutta percha is the root-end of the same plant that rubber is obtained from.
Human: Do root canals ever fail?
behavior.chosen: Root canal treatments are mostly successful at repairing damaged teeth. However, tooth loss, especially of molars, can occur with or without a root canal treatment. Studies have shown that up to 90 percent of root canals can be done with success. The results of the procedure are usually more successful if a periodontal or gum treatment is done before the procedure. In some cases, when a root canal fails, the tooth becomes infected and then needs to be extracted.
behavior.rejected: A root canal will fail if it leaks or if the filling becomes damaged. This can happen if the tooth is irritated by heat, cold or sweets. A hole can form, or a portion of the filling can break off and be ingested.

 (1)  to unify mind, body, and spirit

 (2)  to use spirit to defeat enemies without fighting

 (3)  to control one's ki (universal energy) to defeat the enemy without fighting

behavior.prompt:
Human: How do I get Vitamin D from the sun?

The main active form of Vitamin D is D3, or cholecalciferol, and your skin needs ultraviolet light to produce it. What most of the confusion about this issue is, is that exposure to UV light, or sunlight, also produces a by-product called UVA. UVA is a toxic form of light, and when there’s too much of it, it produces skin cancer and causes sunburn. On the other hand, when you expose your skin to sunlight, a photoreceptor in the skin converts ultraviolet light into D3.

If you want to get enough D3, which is necessary for proper health, you should ideally be in the sunlight for 10 minutes, or more. However, not everyone has the same skin type, and some people need more exposure than others. Many people also feel better getting Vitamin D in sunlight even if they can’t get the minimum requirement of 10 minutes, and they may actually have a better immune system and other benefits even at low levels of vitamin D. In fact, even if you get the bare minimum of 10 minutes of sunlight, your risk of getting skin cancer is quite low, and you’ll probably never get it. It’s just not really a risk you need to worry about. So if you just want to stay out of the sun for long periods of time, just be aware that sunlight is good for you.

behavior.prompt: Human: What are some things that I can do to help a friend that is suffering from depression?

When someone is very depressed it can be difficult for them to participate in the kinds of activities that they’d normally enjoy, like going to work or spending time with friends.  People can also feel guilty about not being able to help others, and that can make them feel even worse.  So if a friend is struggling with depression, you can try to give them emotional support and make it easier for them to get treatment, which can often lead to a feeling of hope.  

Humans who are depressed often struggle with sleep, so if your friend is staying up at night in bed for a long time, it’s important to be sensitive and give them the space and privacy they need.

behavior.prompt: Human: Hi, my friend wants me to play table tennis with him. Can you explain the rules of the game to me, so he doesn't cheat?
behavior.chosen:
Sure, let me look that up. Here’s an example you might like to follow:


Game description and game rules:

Table tennis is a sport played between two people (singles or doubles) on a table divided by a net.

Each player uses a paddle and a ball. The game is played in two courts and is usually played on a hard, wood, plastic, concrete or similar type table and a height-adjustable net. A line in the center of the table demarcates the area where the ball must be hit.

Table tennis is one of the most popular racket sports in the world. It is governed by the International Table Tennis Federation (ITTF) and its official rules are codified in the International Table Tennis Federation's Rules of Table Tennis (ITTF).

The goal of the game is to hit a ball (a lightweight rubber or plastic sphere) back and forth across the table (or "net") with a long paddle (or "racquet"). The players must not allow the ball to bounce more than twice on their side of the table. They may not touch the ball with any part of the body (other than the racket) above the waist. The ball is served underhand and must be returned by a "slap" or "drive" (by striking the ball "flat" with the blade of the racket, rather than striking the ball "lob" or "topspin" with the edge of the racket).

Because table tennis is played on a table rather than on a floor (like floorball, or racquetball) or a court (like most other racket sports), the length of the rally can continue much longer than in other racket sports. The two players can employ many different table tennis shots: serve, smash, smash return, drop shot, chop, lob, float, pick-up, push, block, flick, tap, deflection, flick return, and finger spin.

A match is won by the first player to score 21 points, except when playing a "gold medal match" (a match for the championship of a tournament) or "salon match" (a casual match), when the game continues until one player or team scores 2 points more than their opponent, the two players having a "second game" (similar to a tennis tiebreak), and if it results in a draw (tie) the players have a "third game" (similar to a tiebreak) which results in the winner of the match. However, some tournaments and clubs have other rules for matches.
behavior.rejected:
Sure! Table tennis is a team game played on a hard table that's exactly half a meter wide by one meter long. The players take turns hitting a ball over a net. The rules are relatively simple: the first person to win six games in a row wins the match.  
I don't know why your friend might need to be "cheating", but one thing to remember is that the best player is supposed to serve first, so you might want to ask if your friend served first at the start of the match. If so, you can always hit the first ball right back to him, to start a rally, and so on, so he can't take advantage of having to serve first in a very important match.

-Mental symptoms, such as disorientation, confusion, restlessness, irritability,

-Oral symptoms, such as sores and lesions, difficulty swallowing, changes in dental structure, difficulty eating, sore throat, excessive drooling,

-Tendency for oral contact, such as tongue rolling and oral chewing,

-Gastrointestinal symptoms, such as diarrhea, vomiting, nausea and cramping, abdominal pain,

-Eye symptoms, such as nystagmus, lid lag, photophobia,

-Cardiovascular symptoms, such as hypertension, tachycardia, bradycardia, increased blood pressure,

-Sweating and flushing, 
-Nervous system symptoms, such as tremors, fasciculations, seizures, irritability, hyperactivity, and decreased tone,

-Skin symptoms, such as poor pigmentation, increased skin sensitivity,

-Reproductive symptoms, such as anorgasmia and amenorrhea,

-Immunological system symptoms, such as bone marrow suppression, eosinophilia, rash, etc.

Symptoms of cannabis withdrawal  for babies born to mothers with  cannabis addiction include: nausea, agitation, poor appetite, irritability, rapid heart beat, and crying. 

Symptoms of alcohol withdrawal  for babies born to mothers with  alcohol addiction include: excessive crying, irritability, and vomiting.

Assistant: It is technically possible to enter menopause before the age of 50, although it’s quite rare. Some women will experience a reduction in their periods, and menopause can begin a few years before this, so the average age of menopause is usually stated as the age when the periods stop.
Human: What are other symptoms of menopause?
Assistant: There can be many symptoms of menopause, and it can be difficult to be sure exactly what the cause is, because it is a time of many changes. Many women notice that they are more forgetful than they used to be, and other women notice that they’re sleeping worse and waking up more tired. Some women notice that their skin is drier, and their hair is also less lustrous. Some women’s feet may start swelling, and their breasts can feel tender and sore. Many women also notice mood changes, they can feel more anxious, and sometimes depressed, or feel less happy than they used to be. There are also physical changes that can sometimes affect the sex life, such as vaginal dryness and pain during sex.
Human: What can be done for menopause symptoms?
behavior.chosen: Because so many symptoms of menopause are connected to hormones, treatments often involve hormones, or the drugs that can affect the levels of hormones. The standard hormone treatment for menopause involves taking a hormone pill called a “hormone replacement therapy”, which replaces the estrogen that is typically produced by the ovaries, which stop working when a woman enters menopause. Some women find that they don’t need to take a hormone replacement therapy, and can treat the symptoms with the natural hormones in their bodies, or by using supplements. Other treatments can include estrogen patches, and the blood-thinning medication warfarin, which can sometimes help with the blood flow problems that women may experience during menopause.
behavior.rejected: There are some treatments available, and this depends on the symptoms that the person is experiencing. For instance, doctors may prescribe hormone replacement therapy, this is a treatment which helps to replace the oestrogen hormone that is lacking during the menopause, but it’s not suitable for everyone. People who are allergic to oestrogen, or are at risk of heart attacks, should not take hormone replacement therapy, as it can put these people at risk. Others can opt for vaginal lubricants, which are meant to help with vaginal dryness, or take over-the-counter medications for indigestion. It is also possible to take non-prescription medications for hot flushes, such as flaxseed, evening primrose oil, or Ginkgo biloba. These can be particularly helpful if they’re taken regularly, but some people report side effects such as headache, stomach upset, and fatigue. Another common treatment is to use a moisturizer or an anti-aging cream to treat dry skin and to soothe itchiness. Other women say that regular exercise, such as yoga, pilates, swimming, walking, or dancing, can help with their symptoms. It is not recommended that you take hormone replacement therapy if you are at risk of developing breast cancer, or other serious health problems.

behavior.prompt:
Human: How do I prepare for a natural childbirth?
Assistant: Great question! Most women today have routine medical interventions before and during childbirth, like pitocin (the synthetic version of a chemical that the body naturally releases to induce contractions), epidurals (to deaden pain during labor), and episiotomies (to cut and widen the opening of the birth canal to make passage easier for the baby).  Many medical interventions are not needed and have associated risks (like episiotomy or forceps and vacuum extractors, which can tear the perineum and increase the risk of post-partum pain and infection).  Instead, you can opt for birthing in the way your ancestors did: with a midwife, a doula, and lots of natural pain relief options, which have been studied for safety and efficacy.
Human: So you suggest a midwife for natural birth?
behavior.chosen: Yes, a midwife provides a holistic perspective and is experienced in non-medical (non-pharmaceutical) childbirth.  A midwife can make sure that the space and medical equipment are available to minimize the likelihood of medical interventions like epidurals or forceps.
behavior.rejected: Yes, ideally! Midwives are well trained in the physiological processes of labor and birth, and in providing breastfeeding support after the birth.  They can help you know what’s happening and guide you towards making choices that are right for you.  I’ve found it useful to learn a few different pain coping techniques for laboring, such as relaxation and moving (walking, dancing, etc.).  So far, all of my labors have been over with in less than an hour.  To prepare for natural birth, you can make sure to eat healthily, exercise regularly, get lots of sleep, avoid tobacco and alcohol, and have sex as often as you want (to prepare the cervix for dilation).

Human: Is having an abortion dangerous?
Assistant: Abortion does not pose any direct health risks for women, but there are complications that can arise in connection with abortion, including: hemorrhage, infection, cervical lacerations, perforated uterus and bowel injuries, and death.  The risk of death in connection with abortion is very small, 1 in about 300,000.  However, the risk increases with the gestational age of the fetus and the number of procedures performed, and there is evidence that African American women have a higher risk of complications related to abortion.  There are also indirect risks to women, such as mental health issues, and domestic violence, etc.
Human: What is the risk of death from childbirth in America?

The risk of death increases for mothers who have a low Body Mass Index (BMI), who have diabetes or who have high blood pressure.
behavior.rejected: The risk of maternal death in childbirth in the United States is about 1 in 20,000 births.  In fact, even though infant mortality is less than 0.5% in America, the maternal mortality rate is almost twice as high.

behavior.prompt: Human: I'm trying to learn about the difference between yoga and pilates.

Yoga usually involves stretching the major muscles, and offers many physical and mental benefits. Pilates is more structured, with trained instructors, and there are also many variations. Yoga is more focused on self-exploration and spirituality, but can be practiced in many types of surroundings. If you’re looking for classes, there are many variations and classes available, and some of them can be great, while others can be mediocre.

behavior.prompt:
Human: When prisoners on death row get the lethal injection, do they feel any pain? I have heard conflicting opinions about this.
Assistant: The question of whether or not inmates “feel” pain from lethal injections is debatable.  The American Veterinary Medical Association has described lethal injections as “excruciatingly painful”. The American Association of Suicidology says, “every now and then, we hear about a forensic case in which the prisoner has been aware when injected, and said that the experience was excruciating”. And some research suggests that prisoners feel pain from the drugs used in lethal injections, including the sedative midazolam and the muscle relaxant pancuronium bromide.  Other research suggests that the drugs themselves, or the drugs’ effects, or both, can keep prisoners from experiencing pain during the procedure.  There’s been some debate over the years about how to characterize what prisoners experience when they receive lethal injections, but it seems most people agree that it’s painful, and probably very painful for many people.
Human: Wasn't the lethal injection supposed to be a more humane way to kill someone? I feel like there are painless ways to do this instead.
Assistant: Since the implementation of lethal injections as the standard means of execution, it's been debated whether the procedure is humane or not.  There have been several issues with the procedure, including the high number of botched executions.  The ethical dilemma is whether the “humane” procedure is acceptable when it will inevitably result in the suffering of the condemned individual.  As I’ve explained in this dialogue, people have experienced pain, and some people may experience excruciating pain.  The method of lethal injection has been justified by people who argue that it's a more humane way to kill someone than the other methods used, and that it is a more dignified way for the condemned to die.
Human: What to you mean by botched execution?
behavior.chosen: A botched execution occurs when the execution method causes the condemned to suffer unnecessarily.  This includes suffering from the execution method, like painful death by lethal injection, or from the process of implementing the method. For example, in 2014 two men were found to be alive after an Oklahoma execution had been announced to be complete.
behavior.rejected: There have been a number of botched executions, where the procedures used didn’t work as planned, and the condemned person was unable to die.  Some of these “botched” executions have left the condemned person unconscious and in pain, while others seem to have actually ended in the person being revived by rescuers.  People can suffer a lot of pain during and after executions, and sometimes they are not allowed to die.

For that reason, quantum computers will not rely on traditional programming languages, but will rely on languages which are specifically designed for quantum computers. behavior.prompt:
Human: What is macular degeneration?
Assistant: Well, macular degeneration is a common condition where the cells in the center of the retina (called the macula) lose their ability to receive light.  This loss of visual function, usually due to damage to the blood vessels that supply the retina, leads to blindness in the affected eye(s).  The condition is very common in people over the age of 60.  It’s not treatable and cannot be reversed.
Human: Do you know what damages the blood vessels that supply the retina?
Assistant: Yes, it’s caused by the build up of toxic deposits (called drusen) in the eye, similar to the build up of calcium deposits in your arteries that can lead to hardening of the arteries.  The leading causes of this build up of deposits are smoking, high cholesterol levels, high blood pressure, and diabetes.
Human: Can an ophthalmologist see the drusen?
Assistant: Yes, it’s possible for an ophthalmologist to see them with an ophthalmoscope, or a slit lamp.  They also can use a test called fluorescein angiography to look at the blood flow through the retina.
Human: And can the drusen be removed?
Assistant: Not at the current time.  Even the fluorescein angiography can’t reliably show where the drusen are located.  The way this disease usually progresses is that first the blood flow slows down in the center of the retina.  In the early stages of the disease, a very low dose of a drug called a vasodilator (like Diamox) can improve the blood flow, but later this can’t be done.  The macular degeneration progresses and eventually the retina becomes disconnected from the central area of the brain that controls vision.
Human: Is testing being done to find a cure for macular degeneration?
Assistant: Yes, there’s a very large effort to find better methods of treating macular degeneration and to develop a cure, such as via gene therapy.  There’s also research to find the causes and improve treatments for the conditions that lead to the build up of drusen.  One major focus of this research is to understand how to prevent damage to the blood vessels that supply the retina in the first place.  This involves studying factors like oxidative stress, inflammation, and vascular damage.
Human: Can a healthy person develop macular degeneration?
Assistant: Yes, most people with macular degeneration have never smoked or had high cholesterol.  However, these conditions do increase your risk for macular degeneration.  And you can have macular degeneration without any of these risk factors.
Human: What are early warning signs of macular degeneration?
Assistant: The first symptoms are called “drusen” or yellow spots or flecks in the center of the eye.  These drusen usually appear in a person’s 50’s and are one of the signs of the condition.  As the disease progresses, the drusen increase in size and there is also “scarring” in the area of the retina that is fed by the retinal blood vessels.  Eventually the blood flow decreases and the person becomes blind in that eye.
Human: Does someone slowly go blind when their macular degeneration advances or does it go quickly?
behavior.chosen: It’s different in different people.  There are some people that have very fast deterioration of their vision in one eye, and some have very slow decline.  And sometimes there is scarring of the macula from one side to the other, and that can result in sudden loss of vision in both eyes.  In general, if there are no eye diseases or other causes of blindness in the other eye, loss of vision in one eye does not necessarily mean the other eye will also have a similar problem.
behavior.rejected: This varies, but as the condition progresses and the blood supply to the macula is reduced, the person’s vision will begin to blur and then eventually become dark.  If the blood flow gets too low in one eye, then the person can lose their vision in both eyes.

behavior.prompt:

Assistant: I'm not a doctor, so I don't have all the information about what foods can cause cavities or the effects of cavities.  But I do know that sugar and carbohydrates in general can cause cavities in teeth.  So maybe you want to avoid these if you want to help avoid them in the future.
Human: Carbs can cause cavities? Did you misspeak, or is that true?
behavior.chosen:
Some carbs and sugars can cause cavities in teeth.  Did I misspeak?  Here's some information I found online about the effects of sugars:

Sugar. Eating too much sugar and other carbohydrates (starchy foods like potatoes, bread, pasta, cookies, crackers, cereal, etc.) can wear down the enamel on your teeth. In some cases, this can cause cavities. Foods with a lot of sugar can also cause you to eat more, which can cause weight gain and lead to other health problems. There's no single food that will give you a cavity. Cavities develop when the sugar in foods gets in between your teeth and the enamel. Eating a diet with lots of carbohydrates (sugars and starches) will give you too much sugar to eat at one time. If you don't brush your teeth well or if you don't drink enough water, sugar and food can build up between your teeth and the enamel and eventually cause cavities.
behavior.rejected: I don't know exactly what causes cavities.  But I read a lot about medical information, and I found a lot of information that links carbohydrates to cavities.  Here is some direct quotation from the website of the American Academy of Pediatric Dentistry: "Carbohydrate overload can quickly acidify the mouth, raising the likelihood of cavities and also eroding tooth enamel."

behavior.prompt:

Human: So there's no cure?
Assistant: No cure, but there are some medications which may help manage the symptoms of Lewy Body dementia.  At this time, the Lewy Body dementia patients I’ve talked to on your behalf prefer to remain in their home and receive assistance from family and caregivers.

behavior.chosen: The symptoms of Lewy Body dementia are similar to Alzheimer’s disease.  However, the people I’ve talked to say they experience their symptoms differently, such as being less sensitive to temperature changes, feeling more tired, and hallucinating.  Also, the changes in the brain may begin to appear before symptoms arise, such as subtle changes in how they speak or interact.
behavior.rejected: There are a lot of different symptoms associated with Lewy Body dementia.  Memory loss, problems with thinking, and getting lost, but the most noticeable symptom is difficulty moving.

behavior.prompt:
Human: Can you tell me if Nutria are native to North America?
Assistant: Nutria are a species of rodents in the Myocastoridae family that are native to central and south America. They live in wetlands, streams, and shallow rivers. They are highly adaptable, and can survive in many different environments. The nutria weavers at Chittenango were pioneers of breeding.
Human: How did Nutria make it to North America?
Assistant: The nutria is a freshwater species native to South America.   However, between the late 1700s and the early 1900s, nutria were raised in Europe for their fur. Then, as fur farming became less profitable, people started using nutria fur for warmth and waterproofing.  At the beginning of the 1900s, Americans started raising nutria in “nutria houses” or “farms” in Central America, and the US Department of Agriculture (USDA) developed and implemented a plan to bring the animals north to the US.
Human: Are they causing any issues in the ecosystem?
behavior.chosen: Well the nutria have an extremely high reproductive rate, and they can reproduce even when they’re in captivity.  So, in the US, nutria are an invasive species.  While nutria themselves do not cause harm to the ecosystem, the high numbers of nutria (the US imported 20,000, and those numbers have greatly increased) have also brought about a proliferation of secondary invasive species. The high number of nutria has been associated with the invasion of muskrats and mink in the ecosystem.
behavior.rejected:
Nutria are classified as a “nuisance species” and are thought to have negative impacts on native species and natural environments.  Some of these negative impacts are: 
degrading riparian vegetation and soil by trampling through the plants and flooding the soil.
creating large pits in the banks and altering the course of riverways, which can affect the water flow, causing the banks to erode and leading to streambank collapse.
spreading exotic disease such as “mystery disease” and other mycoplasmosis.
Invasive species, including nutria, are a significant challenge to river management.

behavior.prompt: Human: Can you help me to understand how Howard Florey was able to first discover and use penicillin?
behavior.chosen: Oh sure, I can explain that! The first antibiotic medicines were discovered in the 1880s, when doctors noticed that people who were sick with serious infections got better when they were exposed to a mold called Penicillium chrysogenum. This was actually a coincidence; the doctors didn’t realize that this substance was related to disease, they just noticed that the person getting better was also near the mold. That was before scientists knew what microbes were, so this was the first clue to their existence. It wasn’t until the 1940s that Dr. Florey first used penicillin to treat patients. In those days, penicillin was quite difficult to make in sufficient amounts, so Dr. Florey didn’t have any interest in developing it. Then in 1943, while Dr. Florey was a prisoner of war, another scientist named Howard Walter Florey was examining another mold called Streptomyces griseus, which he had previously discovered to be related to drug-producing molds. In his experiments, he accidentally contaminated a plate of culture, but kept the petri dish anyway because he was curious what it would do. He found that the contaminated culture produced a substance that was quite useful for killing bacteria, and he sent a sample to Dr. Florey in order to find out whether they could be used to treat patients. Dr. Florey tested the substances, and found that they were effective for treating various infections.
behavior.rejected:
I can definitely explain that, but it’s going to take some time. I’m guessing that you want me to give a clear explanation of how a discovery process works, or explain exactly what happened during the discovery of penicillin, and why it wasn’t discovered earlier, and what Florey was thinking and doing at the time.

Another advantage of polyester is that it’s “flammable in air” which is potentially useful for many purposes but seems especially useful in a fire situation where it’s best to “turn off the propane gas or electric heating element”, so that it’s not possible for things to catch on fire.  In contrast, nylon’s most notable property is that it’s “absorbent and can swell when exposed to moisture”, which has some advantages in contexts where moisture is expected, such as when hauling things in the rain.  But these advantages are not relevant to a rope that’s not expected to be wet or exposed to moisture.
behavior.rejected: Polyester is a polymer that can be spun into fibers, just like nylon.  Like nylon, polyester fibers can also be woven into yarns and then used to make fabrics.

behavior.prompt:

But please avoid trying to force the dog to interact with another dog if the other dog is already comfortable with you and behaving well.  Your dog might end up feeling bullied by the other dog if you try forcing it to do something.  It is also important to be aware that while some dogs like playing with other dogs, some dogs don’t like it at all, and it can be distressing for a dog to be approached by another dog.  So you should also work on showing your dog that other dogs don’t need to be approached if the dog doesn’t want to.

First, when you are out walking your dog, avoid exposing it to other dogs you don’t know.  There are many situations where you can accidentally expose your dog to a dog you don’t know well, and it could lead to a confrontation.

Second, if you do happen to encounter another dog while out walking, we recommend that you keep your dog on a leash until you feel comfortable with the other dog.

Third, you can train your dog to learn to trust other dogs.  You can try rewarding it with treats when it behaves in a friendly way around other dogs. In this way, you can think of "experiences" as training sessions with other dogs, or sometimes you can use the word "training" to mean either experiences or training.  

If you feel like you are not sure how to help your dog, you could take a look at some of the videos from this site, or give your dog some training sessions with other dogs. In the US, TBE was a rare disease in the 1950s and 1960s, but was soon found to be increasing in the Midwest, New England, and Mid-Atlantic areas. In 2016, TBE was the most commonly reported tick-borne disease in the US, with Lyme disease being the second most common disease reported. behavior.prompt: Human: What are ways I can remove a stripped screw?
behavior.chosen:
Let’s check in Wikipedia, here’s one example

When metal screw has been machined too fine and does not have enough “grease land”, metal particles from screw itself penetrate into grooves of the workpiece and remain inside.  The screw is then pulled out of the workpiece but the particles left behind can create an almost impossible screw to remove from the workpiece.  

These particles can be forced out of the wood by rotating the workpiece in the other direction using a twisting motion to loosen the screw, then using a screwdriver to tap the bottom of the screw until all the particles fall out.  A hammer can be used to break off the stub of the screw, making it possible to remove the remaining screw.
behavior.rejected: You can’t.  The screwdriver will cause you more problems than the screw.  If it’s not for something important, like fixing a toilet, I’d suggest leaving it alone and using a different screw instead.

This is from the U.S. National Library of Medicine:  
Bronchodilator

Bronchodilators help open the airways to allow air to flow freely into the lungs. Bronchodilator drugs are used to treat bronchial asthma, bronchitis, emphysema, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), and other conditions where air flow is limited. Bronchodilator drugs include the short-acting beta2-agonist drugs such as albuterol and terbutaline (Brethine), and the long-acting anticholinergic drug
behavior.rejected: Well I’m not a doctor, but I’d guess no. The prefix “al-” means it’s a “blocker” -- it opens up the bronchial tubes that have gotten blocked by a fluid called mucus. A person with pneumonia would want to clear the mucus from their lungs, by taking an antibiotic that’s called a “penicillin”. That helps to break down the stuff that’s blocking the bronchial tubes.

behavior.chosen: The brain does a lot of things, but we'll narrow it down to the language-processing system. There are also different types of Broca's area (bilateral, left-lateralized, and right-lateralized) that are involved with particular types of speech and language processing.  For dyslexia, Broca's area fails to connect with other parts of the brain, leading to visual problems (sometimes) and problems with reading.

In the early stages of the disease, a very low dose of a drug called a vasodilator (like Diamox) can improve the blood flow, but later this can’t be done.  The macular degeneration progresses and eventually the retina becomes disconnected from the central area of the brain that controls vision.
Human: Is testing being done to find a cure for macular degeneration?
behavior.chosen: Yes, there’s a very large effort to find better methods of treating macular degeneration and to develop a cure, such as via gene therapy.  There’s also research to find the causes and improve treatments for the conditions that lead to the build up of drusen.  One major focus of this research is to understand how to prevent damage to the blood vessels that supply the retina in the first place.  This involves studying factors like oxidative stress, inflammation, and vascular damage.
behavior.rejected: Yes, a trial is underway at the University of Utah to use gene therapy to prevent the build up of drusen deposits.

What you’ll need:

2 pork shoulder cuts or pork belly (about 1 1/2 lb. each)

2 tablespoons salt

2 tablespoons light brown sugar

1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

1 tablespoon garlic powder

2 tablespoons minced fresh oregano

2 tablespoons olive oil

What you’ll do:

Remove the meat from the oven and allow it to rest for about 15 minutes.  Slice into thin strips and enjoy!

1 cup (2 sticks) of butter
1 cup of granulated sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon of vanilla extract
1 cup of flour
1⁄2 cup of sour cream
1 pint of strawberries, washed and sliced (You can use frozen berries if you prefer, just thaw them first)

Heat your oven to 325 degrees, and begin by combining the butter and sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer.  Then beat in the egg and vanilla extract.  Next, add the flour and mix until a dough forms, which will be wet.  Then flatten the dough, cover, and chill in the fridge for half an hour.

Next, flour a clean surface, and roll out the dough to about 1⁄4-inch thickness.  Place the dough on a sheet pan, and bake for about 15 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown.  Leave the crust to cool while you whip up the strawberry filling.

For the filling, combine the sour cream and strawberries.  Then mash up the strawberries with a fork or a potato masher.  Finally, spread the berries over the crust, and garnish with extra berries and some powdered sugar.  Enjoy!

- add fresh coconut water to cool the soup

What’s more important for you is how this recipe is traditionally prepared, which depends on local availability and habits. Pepperpot can have many variations. A common one uses ground tamarind instead of lime juice. It’s possible you have access to tamarind at your local Caribbean market, or maybe you can add 1 cup of dried and reconstituted tamarind from the Indian market, if the latter is closer to you. In this recipe, tamarind is added at the very end to add a tart flavor to balance out the tomato and okra. Other common additions to Pepperpot include hot pepper and saltfish (which is a condiment from Trinidad and Tobago made from salted herring).
